Key Arguments: The legislation would lead to censorship of Australians' views online.
There is no single arbiter or panel of truth, as scientific understanding evolves over time.
Free speech is essential for human progress and innovation.
Concerns about how 'harms to health' will be defined and who will decide what is untrue.
The ACMA should not have the power to determine truthfulness.
Encouraging debate and critical thinking is a better approach to handling misinformation.
Main Themes: Evolving nature of truth and scientific understanding
Role of government and tech companies in regulating information
Importance of critical thinking and debate
Notable Quotes: There is no single arbiter or panel of truth.
The only way to cope with mis or disinformation is to encourage more debate and to create a society where critical thinking and intellectual curiosity is the norm.
Human progress in every field depends on free speech.
